definition:
The topology for $X\bigcup \{\infty\}$ is defined as follows: there are
two kinds of open sets of $X\bigcup \{\infty\}$. If $\infty \notin U$,
then $U$ is open if and only if $U$ is an open set in the topology of
$X$. If $\infty \in U$, then $U$ is open if and only if $U$ is the
complement of a closed compact subset $K$ of $X$.
phrase: Something Related To Alexandrov One-Point Compactification
